description.narrative: The Project (Kalmykia Roads) builds on the World Bank Groups successful subnational experience in Russia and on IFCs track record of supporting the road sector reform and investments in frontier regions in CEU, including Republic of Chuvashia and Republic of Mari El in Russia and the City of Chisinau in Moldova. The proposed Project envisages financing of the road sector investments in Republic of Kalmykia, another frontier region in Russia. It is aimed at improving the Republics core road network and preventing it from further deterioration. This Project is expected to start a long-term relationship with the Republic and its new management to support local underdeveloped infrastructure. The objective of the proposed IFC engagement is to preserve a part of existing road assets in Kalmykia, generally in a very poor condition, that is still structurally sound, by undertaking relatively low-cost interventions. These roads can be protected from further deterioration and brought back in good condition by carrying out localized repairs and an overlay of asphalt concrete, at a cost that is only a fraction (about 15%) of the cost of reconstruction.

The proposed Project is expected to conserve valuable network assets lowering vehicle operating costs. The Project is also expected to contribute to the balanced terms structure of the Republic''s debt to better match the expected benefit stream from its investments.

name.narrative: The Republic of Kalmykia is located in the southern part of the country bordering the Caspian Sea. The total length of the road network in the Republic of Kalmykia is about 1,843 km. Within that network, 628 km are federal roads which carry mostly long-distance transit traffic with origin and destination outside Kalmykia, with a large share of heavy trucks. The republican road network has a length of 1,215 km; it carries mostly local traffic and a lower share of heavy vehicles.
